message: Yes
No actually, it is for students anywhere in the world. I am looking for students who want to build their portfolio on the side.
It's amazing how much opportunity is out there for a programmer, probably why you see so many of them on YC. I can't think of an industry that's as organized for innovation and opportunity. So...
I don't think YC is illustrative of the entire young programmer space
set up like, an intern package, so people know what they're getting into/applying too
RoR student?
I perceive that as taking advantage of them.
What websites would you go to to look for students who want an internship?
How can I find people like you?
@AymericG it is quite hard to find us from finland where I live
there's so few of us
and I know everybody who codes ruby for living ;)
I'm a student but they don't teach RoR in our school...
could be my assumption; do you pay interns?
but still I'm working as a ror developer currently :)
That's what I meant :) A student who learned Ruby on Rails :)
Maybe try https://convore.com/rails/ ?  It's still new but there may be people who check that.
@AymericG http://careers.stackoverflow.com/employer/search There's a box you can check for "internship." And it goes without saying that browsing a user's Stack Overflow contributions is a cool.
@nessence "I perceive that as taking advantage of them" Why's that?
a lot of developers have gotten burned, anyone you find who doesn't work for pay just hasn't been burned yet (or sucks and will waste your time)
@thesethings Wow, the price to be able to see the candidates is steep. $500 for one week...
Where do students generally go to to find internships? (I will check convore.com/rails thanks)
But I think this discussion is for SV or USA...
I'd like to work in Berlin btw :P
I'm quite good with ror, vim, linux and ec2 config
@AymericG how much do you pay?
@thesethings Thanks!
@AymericG Building a portfolio piece is not good enough for an internship.   You need to provide value beyond the scope of the project if you want a good student programmer to work for low wages.
if there's some rails jobs in that city please let me know :)
yeah, it's unfortunate. cost of living's just expensive, I don't think programmers are cheap anymore.

@nessence Yes. I run a website where I help freelancers find gigs (and help clients outsource work). I get asked for Ruby on Rails developers but I can't recommend any at the moment as I don't know anyone good. The reason why I am looking for students is because they are willing to learn new stuff (node.js, backbone.js, etc...) and are cheaper.

@AymericG Doh, sorry about that. Didn't realize you had a limit. Going from the "pull" method, 37signals charges $400 to post a single listing, so it's about market for *target* stuff.  S.O. has awesome filtering/context. But if I were on a budget, I would post here, and Hacker News. (A "who's hiring" type thing.)
I think the reason it's hard for you to find them is we all have a choice of what we want to do. So, you don't find me, I find you (if that makes sense).
You could "productize it" like YC do
@pimeys: we do rails development in berlin: http://finn.de
@rkh Cool, we're planning to move to Berlin next autumn with my girlfriend.
@rkh and we're there on holiday from Fusion to the end of the July
I have a group for internships, https://convore.com/internship/
and I've touched Ruby before but not ROR and I am looking for internships.. contact me if you're interested
@AymericG Well I'm a CS student and am actively learning RoR and would love to hear more if you will :)
hi
